conclusion: Analyze forces and induced EMF due to rod motion in magnetic field
Identify forces acting on the rod: gravitational force and magnetic force
Gravitational force component along the rail: mg sin θ
Magnetic force due to induced current: FB = BIL
Induced EMF in the rod due to motion in magnetic field: E = BLv
Current in the circuit using Ohm's law: I = BLv / (R + r)
Magnetic force acting on the rod: FB = B^2 L^2 v / (R + r)
Net force along the rail: F_net = mg sin θ - FB
Equation of motion: a = g sin θ - B^2 L^2 v / m(R + r)
At maximum speed, acceleration is zero: v_max = mg sin θ (R + r) / B^2 L^2
Solve differential equation for time to reach maximum speed
Rod accelerates until magnetic force balances gravitational force
Time constant τ for system: τ = m(R + r) / B^2 L^2
Approximate time to reach significant fraction of terminal velocity: t ≈ 3τ
Final answer: t ≈ 3 m(R + r) / B^2 L^2
